timeline.author: npepinpe

timeline.bodyText: We have a zeebe-test-util module, where we group test utilities. Do you think this could fit there, as opposed to depending on the test JAR of the client module?
timeline.author: npepinpe

replies.bodyText: I think it would fit there. However, then zeebe-test-util would have to depend on zeebe-client-java which defines Topology. Not sure if this is intended. Please advise.
replies.author: pihme

replies.bodyText:
That's a good point. I don't think the goal of this module were ever clearly defined. What would be the downsides here? The only one I can think of is that the client could not later depend on zeebe-test-util if we ever needed it. I guess it's a trade off - having zeebe-test-util vs the test JAR. I would prefer zeebe-test-util personally, and we can always refactor this kind of thing out into an e2e utility module if we have a need for it later on (as that's really where it should be, I guess).
What do you think?
replies.author: npepinpe

replies.bodyText: In this case I would prefer it in the test-util module. This is where I would look for it. In the other place I would have to know it is there in order to find it.
replies.author: pihme

timeline.bodyText: Is this because the config may not have been initialized through the Broker yet? If so it feels a little fragile, having this call coming from different places; do we have any other options? Or perhaps it's not as big of a deal as I think, what do you think?
timeline.author: npepinpe

replies.bodyText:
The broker has not initialized the config yet. Also, we cannot initialize the full BrokerCfg configuration yet, because we don't yet know the folder in which the broker will run.
I don't think it is a big deal, because right now this is an idempotent operation. This branch of the config tree does not depend on anything the broker adds later.
I'm not a big fan of it, but I think it's ok.
replies.author: pihme

replies.bodyText: Yeah, when I said fragile I meant because of this - right now it's an idempotent operation, but it's not really enforced, so I can imagine that changing and us spending time trying to figure out why this is behaving unexpectedly 😅 But you're probably right and I'm being too cautious here
replies.author: npepinpe

replies.bodyText: I would say so. Nothing wrong with caution, but our users are having far greater pains right now. I am happy to leave this tiny maybe problem to the future.
replies.author: pihme

timeline.author: npepinpe

timeline.bodyText:
I'm not familiar with this framework RestAssured, but I like it, great stuff 👍
Maybe when we wrap up the OKR and we show it off, you can also mention how to test these things, as I don't know if everybody on the team is familiar with this.
